text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with Italian Wedding soup if you
grew up in the Northeast and are Italian
or know Italians and went to weddings
you probably have this soup so I'm going
to do is take a beef soup bone a beef
shank you want to look for one that has
a nice big piece of marrow bone in it
I'm going to brown that on both sides in
the soup pot and a little bit of
vegetable oil I'm going to add the
classic mirepoix celery carrots onions
I'm going to add a couple quarts of cold
water okay I'm gonna throw in a bay leaf
a few cloves of garlic some black
peppercorns and we're going to make just
a simple beef stock we're going to bring
this up to a simmer and then back the
heat down just so it does that a slow
gentle simmer for like four or five
hours you're going to simmer it until
the meat falls off the bone you're going
to add more water if necessary to keep
the level sort of around which you
started at I want to end up with about a
quart of beef stock okay so while our
stock is working I'm gonna make the
meatball mixture this is boneless beef
short ribs that I want you to put in the
freezer till they're firm then I want
you to cut it in cubes put it back in
the freezer until it's just almost
frozen it shouldn't be hard but it
shouldn't be soft alright it should be
just very very firm and cold to the
touch
all right so half frozen I'll say so as
the meat is firming up in the freezer
let's get our wet ingredients ready I

that's going to be really tough and

because you're using such cold meat and

all right bring that to a simmer taste

makes it really easy and they all sort

this is kind of a big batch of meatball

it's not going to be totally cooked but

by that time meatballs cooked and tender
